Posted By: holgir (8/5/2009 3:15:16 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This might be my favorite white instant to date.  
Fantastic art.  
A name with an exclamation point.  
Effect with nigh endless applications; from combat shenanigans to getting stupid amounts of mana from your mana dorks.  
Fairly costed, and then they throw in a cantrip.  
And not just a line, but a whole story for flavor text.  
Certainly more powerful cards out there, but this seems more fun.  
  
Only two problems;  
One: Why hasn't this become a core set staple?  
Two: Why won't this system let me rate it higher than 5?
posts.html:
This might be my favorite white instant to date.
Fantastic art.
A name with an exclamation point.
Effect with nigh endless applications; from combat shenanigans to getting stupid amounts of mana from your mana dorks.
Fairly costed, and then they throw in a cantrip.
And not just a line, but a whole story for flavor text.
Certainly more powerful cards out there, but this seems more fun.

Only two problems;
One: Why hasn't this become a core set staple?
Two: Why won't this system let me rate it higher than 5?

posts.post_content:
Makes you want to splash white in Tim decks. And many decks that include [isochron scepter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=isochron scepter).  
  
I am hesitant to throw this into my casual decks because I play with people who are paranoid about attacking for no good reason. This kind of trick would mess them up forever.   
  
A good reason to never use [Masako the Humorless](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Masako the Humorless).
